intro: Gumira odorata, commonly known as the fragrant gumira, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. Its fragrance is often described as sweet and spicy, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Gumira odorata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring partial shade and well-drained soil.
